citation.title: Crystal structure of the human phosphodiesterase 9a catalytic domain.

comment.text: Hydrolyzes the second messenger cGMP, which is a key regulator of many important physiological processes.
Binds 2 divalent metal cations per subunit. Site 1 may preferentially bind zinc ions, while site 2 has a preference for magnesium and/or manganese ions.

Expressed in all tissues examined (testis, brain, small intestine, skeletal muscle, heart, lung, thymus, spleen, placenta, kidney, liver, pancreas, ovary and prostate) except blood. Highest levels in brain, heart, kidney, spleen, prostate and colon. Isoform PDE9A12 is found in prostate.
Composed of a C-terminal catalytic domain containing two putative divalent metal sites and an N-terminal regulatory domain.
Belongs to the cyclic nucleotide phosphodiesterase family. PDE9 subfamily.

feature.description: In isoform PDE9A3 and isoform PDE9A16.
In isoform PDE9A6, isoform PDE9A12 and isoform PDE9A17.
In isoform PDE9A9 and isoform PDE9A18.
In isoform PDE9A2, isoform PDE9A3, isoform PDE9A6, isoform PDE9A9 and isoform PDE9A21.
Reduces catalytic activity, but has no effect on substrate affinity.
